Text.Text: More strangers?  Hmmm... I am Suoma, the village elder and teacher of magic - I welcome you.  You must forgive our grim faces - these are dark times for us.
Yes?
There is a drow here, a merchant, who came not long ago.  He is seeking someone - you may wish to speak with him.
I know nothing of him... only that he came to find someone that he was certain would pass by our village.
You speak of the Fell Wood, yes?  It is a dark and terrible place.  The trail to the Cold Marshes beyond the forest is difficult to find... in this village, I alone know the way.
The Cold Marshes are fraught with peril... barbarians, snow trolls, and worse lurk there.  No villager need know the way.
I... cannot.  Not now, at least.

Soon after these dark times fell upon us, I dreamt of strangers - girded for battle they were, with eyes like fire and their hands heavy with the tools of war.  Yet, somehow, I knew they had come to aid the village, and not destroy it...

Yes.  Forgive me, but I cannot give you your answers just yet.  I must ask that you speak with Venla the Healer, first - she will tell you what must be done.  Please help us, and we shall help you in turn.
I am grateful, and certain all the children and their parents are as well.  Still, I must ask another boon of you... please speak with Tahvo the Huntmaster, now.
Good, good... I thank you.  Still, I regret that I must ask one last favor... please, go speak with Kurttu, the stepmother of the widow Carita.
I cannot express my gratitude... but I can beg your forgiveness.  I hope that you do not hate the people of this village for what we've put you through...
There is a certain sort of monster in the Fell Wood, horrific abominations known as dark treants.  It is their warping influence that hides the true path from you.
You will find them in the darkest depths of the woods.  They will sense that you know them, now, and will come to you.  They are terrible, hateful opponents... take great care.
My thanks... that was most kind of you.  I will see that they are properly interred.  You are a caring soul, indeed.

We call this "Wandering Village," as we move several days' travel each year.  We hunt, fish, and gather, trading pelts and medicinal summer marsh-herbs with distant southern villages for those goods we lack...
...you would do well to speak with Tahvo the Huntmaster and Venla the Healer - both have goods that may interest you.  Other villagers can tell you more about the surrounding area.
Many things, traveler.  The worst of it concerns our children - many have gone missing of late.

Yes... and I can help you in return.  If you intend to continue traveling eastwards, you must pass through the haunted Fell Wood.  The trail to the Cold Marshes beyond the forest is difficult to find... in this village, I alone know the way.
Well met.  Have you finished helping Venla, traveler?
Greetings, again.  Have you, by chance, helped Tahvo?
Ah, greetings.  Have you managed to aid Kurttu and Carita?
Greetings again, traveler.  Is there something that you seek?
It is good to see you - I owe you a great debt, as does all the Wandering Village.  How might I help you, traveler?

Terrible creatures, those demon-kin!  I am greatly saddened that innocent villagers were drawn into your battle with them... though I suppose the responsibility is mine, as I alone kept you here so long.
Yes... yes, I suppose so.  In any case, there is nothing to be done about it now.  However cruel, this is the cycle of life.  We shall go on as we always have...
Wait - something... someone has come.  A terrible, dark power has set upon this village, and it seeks... it seeks *you.*  There - at the village gate...
Many things, traveler.
"More strangers?"  Who else is here?
What troubles this village, Suoma?
What troubles this village, Suoma?
Can you tell me about this village?
What can you tell me of Nym?
How do I pass through the woods to the east?
I've brought the remains of the Fell Wood dead.
Can you teach me spells?
Greetings, and farewell.
You had said that something troubles this village?
You had said that something troubles this village?
Can you tell me about this village?
What can you tell me of Nym?
How do I pass through the woods to the east?
I've brought the remains of the Fell Wood dead.
Can you teach me spells?
Never mind.  Farewell.
You had said that something troubles this village?
You had said that something troubles this village?
Can you tell me about this village?
How do I pass through the woods to the east?
I've brought the remains of the Fell Wood dead.
Can you teach me spells?
My thanks.  Farewell.
You had said that something troubles this village?
You had said that something troubles this village?
Can you tell me about this village?
How do I pass through the woods to the east?
I've brought the remains of the Fell Wood dead.
Can you teach me spells?
My thanks.  Farewell.
Why only you?
Would you tell me the way, then?
Wait - I had other questions.
We'll speak later, Suoma.  Farewell.
Would you tell me the way, then?
Wait - I had other questions.
We'll speak later, Suoma.  Farewell.
Why not?
Wait - I had other questions.
We'll speak later, Suoma.  Farewell.
And you think we're those strangers...
I don't have time for this.  Farewell.
I've already helped Venla - the children are safe.
I had other questions.
Farewell, Suoma.
I've already helped Tahvo, too.  The barrow wight is at peace.
I had other questions.
Farewell, Suoma.
I did.  Carita murdered Kyosti; her lover hid the corpse.  Both have fled.
I had other questions.
Farewell, Suoma.
I was happy to help.  Now, about that forest to the east...
How do I get through the Fell Wood?
I'm thinking of razing the place.  Give me my information.
I'll return later, Suoma.  Farewell.
How do I find them?
My thanks.  I had other questions.
I've brought the remains of the Fell Wood dead.
I will.  Thanks, Suoma, and farewell.
I had some questions.
Actually, I was simply bored.  Farewell.
Farewell, Suoma.
Go on...
Wait - I had other questions.
I'll hear the rest later.  Farewell.
I see.  I had other questions.
Thanks.  Farewell, Suoma.
Is there something I can do to help?
You mentioned other strangers - who else is here?
I see.  I had some questions.
That's too bad.  Farewell, Suoma.
Why only you?
Would you tell me the way, then?
Wait - I had other questions.
We'll speak later, Suoma.  Farewell.
Yes, I have - the children are safe.
No, but I had questions.
Not yet.  Farewell, Suoma.
Yes - the barrow wight is at peace.
No, but I had questions.
Not yet.  Farewell, Suoma.
I did.  Carita murdered Kyosti; her lover hid the corpse.  Both have fled.
No, but I had questions.
Not yet.  Farewell, Suoma.
You mentioned other strangers, before.  Who else is here?
Tell me, Suoma - what troubles this village?
Tell me, Suoma - what troubles this village?
Can you tell me about this village?
What can you tell me of Nym?
How do I pass through the woods to the east?
I've brought the remains of the Fell Wood dead.
Can you teach me spells?
I was only passing by.  Farewell.
How do I get through the Fell Wood?
Can you tell me about this village?
What can you tell me of Nym?
I've brought the remains of the Fell Wood dead.
Can you teach me spells?
I was only passing by.  Farewell, Suoma.
These things happen, Suoma.  You can't blame yourself.
It serves you right.  The world outside your tiny village is important, too, but you ignored that.
Can you tell me about this village?
What can you tell me of Nym?
I've brought the remains of the Fell Wood dead.
Can you teach me spells?
Farewell, Suoma.
Can you tell me about this village?
What can you tell me of Nym?
I've brought the remains of the Fell Wood dead.
Can you teach me spells?
Farewell, Suoma.
Is there something I can do to help?
You mentioned other strangers - who else is here?
I see.  I had some questions.
That's too bad.  Farewell, Suoma.
We'll talk after I take care of the monsters I led here.
